description:
It looks nice but it should dynamically show CPU governer, platform_profile, available frequency as per the cpu and system it is running on. 
Not sure if that is possible but I'm gonna try to built a python version of it using tkmodule. 

 I tried running it as python but it was not installing the depedencies...I guess that's my fault as I'm still a noob LOL.

I just migrated from Windows to Linux and I wondered where I could get a replacement for Lenovo Vantage :DD Well this is 10000 times better than Vantage. Don't skip on this please! If you just want to quickly switch between e.g conservation mode, there's Lenovo Vantage for Linux too but install TLP-UI too please!! https://github.com/niizam/vantage
Makes setting TLP options so much easier. I didn't even realize some settings were commented out and therefore not working, that explains a lot.
Thanks for making this gui, it helps tremendously when trying tlp for the first time
this is way better than searching for every parameter and the insert it using editor, this UI really helps
